meanings.definition: To purchase more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She outbought all her friends at the store.
meanings.sent2: He outbought his siblings when it came to buying gifts.
meanings.sent3: The competitive shopper outbought everyone in the store.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outbuy others outbought even the most seasoned shoppers.
meanings.sent5: Outbuying her competitors, she outbought them all with her savvy shopping skills.

meanings.sent1: She outbought the items before they went out of stock.
meanings.sent2: He outbought all the products on sale last week.
meanings.sent3: The savvy shopper outbought everyone in the store with his quick decisions.
meanings.sent4: Having outbought everything in sight, he left the store feeling accomplished.
meanings.sent5: Outbuying his friends, he outbought them all with his strategic shopping spree.
